# unicorn/prefer-array-flat-map <Badge type="info" text="Style" />

<div class="rule-meta">
<Alert class="fix" type="info">
<span class="emoji">üõ†Ô∏è</span> An auto-fix is available for this rule.
</Alert>
</div>

### What it does

Prefers the use of `.flatMap()` when `map().flat()` are used together.

### Why is this bad?

It is slightly more efficient to use `.flatMap(‚Ä¶)` instead of `.map(‚Ä¶).flat()`.

### Example

```javascript
const bar = [1, 2, 3].map((i) => [i]).flat(); // ‚úó fail

const bar = [1, 2, 3].flatMap((i) => [i]); // ‚úì pass
```

## How to use

To **enable** this rule in the CLI or using the config file, you can use:

::: code-group

```bash [CLI]
oxlint --deny unicorn/prefer-array-flat-map
```

```json [Config (.oxlintrc.json)]
{
  "rules": {
    "unicorn/prefer-array-flat-map": "error"
  }
}
```

:::
